results.title: 'Cos it's naughty (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Goldwyn and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Children Thinking”.
Interaction between parent and child in the child’s growing understanding of right and wrong. How does the child know what a lie is? How can the child begin understanding the framework of good and naughty imposed on them by adults?
results.description:

results.title: The Moon follows me (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Children Thinking”.
In the second of the series the children’s thinking is shown to be logical but limited by reliance on direct perceptual evidence and by inability to imagine other viewpoints.

results.title: Discovering the world (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children Thinking”.
First of four studies of the development of thinking in children from five to ten. Shows how their drawing and painting expresses understanding of their environment and traces its development.

results.title: Here comes the judge (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
The development of moral judgement is related to intellectual development. Through improvised drama, young children and adolescents are introduced to a moral dilemma and their changing attitudes are explored.

results.title: All in the game (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
All the aspects of development so far considered in this series come together in play. The quality and type of play depend on all three. The way in which individual and group play develops, and the various forms this play takes are examined in this program. Narrated by Hugh David.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC-TV

results.title: All in the game
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
Final part of the series considers all the aspects of development coming together in a study of play. The quality and type of play depend on all of them. Looks at the ways in which individual and group play develop. Narrated by Hugh David.

results.title: How far how soon? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
This program covers the range and pattern of normal physical development and, where possible, relates this to the emotional changes which occur. However, children of the same chronological age may vary enormously in their true maturity. This has implications for school assessment, relationships and the early choice of future careers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Making sense (TEFC) [Colour]
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
A new born baby has all the five senses needed to perceive his outside world, but making something of it is a slow developmental process. This program constructs situations and experiments to demonstrate how a child sees and makes sense of the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
